instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 pulsing rails
threads.message:
Hey there :-)

I got another 820-00165 with some problems. It is in S5 State and nearly all other power rails are pulsing:
Lokked like someone else already worked on this board before. But no signs of liquid damage, all probe points look very clean.
The Board is taking 24mA - sometimes dropping to 14mA.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
[TABLE]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT][B]Rail[/B][/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][B]Voltage[/B][/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][B]Resistance to Ground[/B][/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PPBUS_G3H[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]8.6V[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP3V42_G3H[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]3.41V[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP5V_S5[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]5.01V[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP3V3_S5[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]3.33V[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT][/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]

[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]3.53kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]

[/TR]

[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP1V2_S3[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]0.5kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP1V5_S0[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]4kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP0V6_S0_DDRVTT[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]0.25kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP1V05_S0[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]0.25kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PP1V05_S0SW_PCH_HSIO[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]0.5kO[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[TR]
[TD][LEFT]PPVCC_S0_CPU[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]pulsing[/LEFT][/TD]
[TD][LEFT]14O[/LEFT][/TD]
[/TR]
[/TABLE]

When i remove U8005 I got a steady fanspin and stable rails.
What I already tried: 

-reballing SMC,
-flash new BIOS
-new U6100 from donor
-replace U8005

Bes regards 
DudiPupan

threads.title: 820-00165 pulsing rails
threads.message: With SMC bypass I get pulsing short fan spins.

threads.title: 820-00165 pulsing rails
threads.message: Check for pulse at pin 3/U1950, CPU_VR_READY and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-00165 pulsing rails
threads.message:
Looks like PCH issue then.
Heat it for test...
